crops.name: Tomatoes (cordon)
crops.where: Greenhouse, polytunnel, warm patio (best under cover in Wales)
crops.protection: Fleece on cold nights; blight hygiene outdoors
crops.tips: Remove side-shoots, feed high-potash weekly once trusses set, water consistently
crops.notes: Choose blight-tolerant/outdoor varieties if growing outside

crops.name: Tomatoes (bush/tumbler)
crops.protection: Shelter from persistent rain to reduce blight risk
crops.tips: No side-shoot removal for true bush types; steady watering prevents split fruit
crops.notes: Great for small spaces and balconies

crops.name: Peppers (Sweet/Bell)
crops.where: Greenhouse/polytunnel; very warm patio in summer
crops.protection: Requires heat under cover in Wales
crops.tips: Stake plants, mist flowers for pollination, feed weekly once flowering

crops.name: Chillies
crops.where: Greenhouse, sunny windowsill, warm patio in midsummer
crops.protection: Best under cover; bring inside late season to ripen
crops.tips: Do not overwater; pick regularly to encourage more fruit

crops.name: Aubergine
crops.tips: Stake; pinch growing tip after 5–6 fruits set to focus ripening

crops.name: Cucumber (greenhouse)
crops.tips: Train up strings/trellis; avoid cold drafts; feed regularly
crops.notes: Choose all-female hybrids for high yield

crops.name: Cucumber (ridge/outdoor)
crops.tips: Mulch to keep roots warm; water at soil level
crops.notes: Choose outdoor varieties for open ground

crops.name: Courgette / Marrow
crops.protection: Cloche early in season; slug control
crops.tips: Harvest small and often; feed weekly in containers
crops.notes: Patty pan types also suitable for pots

crops.name: Winter Squash (incl. Pumpkin)
crops.where: Open soil or very large containers
crops.protection: Cloche early; black mulch to warm soil
crops.tips: Feed and water generously; lift fruit on tiles late season
crops.notes: Bush types suit containers better than trailing

crops.name: Sweetcorn
crops.protection: Cloche young plants; support if windy
crops.tips: Grow in blocks for wind pollination; keep well watered in tasseling
crops.notes: Check cobs for milky kernels to judge ripeness

crops.name: Tomatillo
crops.tips: Grow at least two plants for pollination; supports helpful
crops.notes: Fruits in husks; great for salsa verde

crops.name: Cucamelon (Melothria)
crops.tips: Train onto netting; steady watering improves yield

crops.name: Okra (trial)
crops.protection: Requires warmth; do not allow roots to chill
crops.tips: Pick pods small and often; feed regularly
crops.notes: Borderline crop—best in hot summers or under cover

crops.name: Physalis / Cape Gooseberry
crops.protection: Shelter from wind/rain; bring under cover to finish ripening
crops.tips: Fruits ripen when husks turn paper-brown and drop
crops.notes: Tolerates cooler nights better than tomato
